trans-unit.source: Represents a processing instruction, which XML defines to keep processor-specific information in the text of the document.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.XmlProcessingInstruction"></xref> class.
Do not instantiate an <xref:System.Xml.XmlProcessingInstruction> directly; instead, use methods such as <xref:System.Xml.XmlDocument.CreateProcessingInstruction%2A>.
The target of the processing instruction; see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlProcessingInstruction.Target*> property.
The content of the instruction; see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlProcessingInstruction.Data*> property.
The parent XML document.
Creates a duplicate of this node.
`CloneNode` serves as a copy constructor for nodes.
For processing instruction nodes, the cloned node always includes the target and data.
To see how this method behaves with other node types, see the <xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.CloneNode%2A> method in the `XmlNode` class.
The cloned node has no parent (<xref:System.Xml.XmlNode.ParentNode%2A> returns `null`).

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to recursively clone the subtree under the specified node; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to clone only the node itself.
The duplicate node.
Gets or sets the content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.
The content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.
Gets or sets the concatenated values of the node and all its children.
This property is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
The concatenated values of the node and all its children.
Gets the local name of the node.
For processing instruction nodes, this property returns the target of the processing instruction.
Gets the qualified name of the node.
For processing instruction nodes, this property returns the target of the processing instruction.
Gets the type of the current node.
For <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlProcessingInstruction" name="XmlProcessingInstruction" href=""></xref> nodes, this value is XmlNodeType.ProcessingInstruction.
Gets the target of the processing instruction.
The target of the processing instruction.
Gets or sets the value of the node.
The entire content of the processing instruction, excluding the target.
Node is read-only.
Saves all the children of the node to the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
Because ProcessingInstruction nodes do not have children, this method has no effect.
This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlWriter" name="XmlWriter" href=""></xref> to which you want to save.
Saves the node to the specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
This method is a Microsoft extension to the Document Object Model (DOM).
The <xref uid="langword_csharp_XmlWriter" name="XmlWriter" href=""></xref> to which you want to save.
